definition: to use/to employ/to have to/to eat or drink/expense or outlay/usefulness/hence/therefore
France/French/abbr. for 法國|法国[Fa3 guo2]/Taiwan pr. [Fa4]
law/method/way/to emulate/(Buddhism) dharma/(abbr. for 法家[Fa3 jia1]) the Legalists/(physics) farad (abbr. for 法拉[fa3 la1])

sentences.english: Is it when a new idiom is measurably better ?
sentences.chinese: 只有當證明了一個新的習慣用法更好時嗎？

sentences.english: In his lecture, he bore down on the importance of idiomatic usage in a language.
sentences.chinese: 他在演講中着重強調了語言中習慣用法的重要性。

sentences.english: It is a book of English phonetics , grammar and usage all in one.
sentences.chinese: 這是一本英語語音，語法和習慣用法合爲一體的著作。
文法無法勝過習慣用法。

sentences.english: What the students find mos difficult in a foreign language is its idiomatic usage.
sentences.chinese: 學生感到，一種外語最困難的地方是它的習慣用法。
